data.chText: 假扮；装扮；伪装
data.enText: to change your appearance so that people cannot recognize you

data.chText: 劫持者伪装得严严实实。
data.enText: The hijackers were heavily disguised.

data.chText: 她女扮男装。
data.enText: She disguised herself as a boy.

data.chText: 他们装扮成保安人员混了进去。
data.enText: They got in disguised as security guards.

data.chText: 掩蔽；掩饰
data.enText: to hide sth or change it, so that it cannot be recognized

data.chText: 她毫不掩饰自己的惊奇。
data.enText: She made no attempt to disguise her surprise.

data.chText: 显而易见这是在攻击总统。
data.enText: It was a thinly disguised attack on the President.

data.chText: 她无法掩饰她那不安的心情。
data.enText: She couldn't disguise the fact that she felt uncomfortable.

data.chText: 伪装物；化装用具
data.enText: a thing that you wear or use to change your appearance so that people do not recognize you

data.chText: 她用眼镜和假发伪装起来。
data.enText: She wore glasses and a wig as a disguise.

data.chText: 这位明星化了装去旅行。
data.enText: The star travelled in disguise (= wearing a disguise ) .

data.chText: 投自由民主党的票不过是改头换面投工党的票。
data.enText: A vote for the Liberal Democrats is just a Labour vote in disguise .

data.chText: 假扮；装扮；伪装
data.enText: the art of changing your appearance so that people do not recognize you

data.chText: 他是伪装高手。
data.enText: He is a master of disguise.
a blessing in disguise

data.chText: 因祸得福；祸中有福
data.enText: something that seems to be a problem at first, but that has good results in the end

data.text: hide ♦ conceal ♦ cover ♦ disguise ♦ mask ♦ camouflage

data.chText: 以上各词均含藏、隐藏、掩盖、隐瞒之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to put or keep sb/sth in a place where they/it cannot be seen or found, or to keep the truth or your feelings secret.
hide

data.chText: 指藏、隐藏、掩盖（尤指感情）：
data.enText: to put or keep sb/sth in a place where they/it cannot be seen or found; to keep sth secret, especially your feelings

data.chText: 他把信藏在抽屉里。
data.enText: He hid the letter in a drawer.

data.chText: 她设法掩藏住自己的失望。
data.enText: She managed to hide her disappointment.
conceal

data.chText: 指隐藏、隐瞒、掩盖：
data.enText: ( formal ) to hide sb/sth; to keep sth secret

data.chText: 那些画藏在厚厚的灰泥层下面。
data.enText: The paintings were concealed beneath a thick layer of plaster.

data.chText: 蒂姆几乎掩饰不住自己的失望。
data.enText: Tim could barely conceal his disappointment.

data.chText: conceal指掩藏感情时常用于否定句。
data.enText: When it is being used to talk about emotions, conceal is often used in negative statements.
cover

data.chText: 指掩蔽、遮盖：
data.enText: to place sth over or in front of sth in order to hide it

data.chText: 她双手掩面。
data.enText: She covered her face with her hands.
disguise

data.chText: 指掩蔽、掩饰、伪装，以免被认出：
data.enText: to hide or change the nature of sth, so that it cannot be recognized

data.chText: 他竭力掩饰自己的口音。
data.enText: He tried to disguise his accent.
mask

data.chText: 指掩饰、掩藏（情感、气味、事实等），以免被看出或注意到：
data.enText: to hide a feeling, smell, fact, etc. so that it cannot be easily seen or noticed

data.chText: 她用微笑来掩饰她的愤怒。
data.enText: She masked her anger with a smile.
camouflage

data.chText: 指通过使人或事物与周围环境或其他事物相似而达到伪装、掩饰的目的：
data.enText: to hide sb/sth by making them/it look like the things around, or like sth else

data.chText: 士兵用树枝和树叶来伪装自己。
data.enText: The soldiers camouflaged themselves with leaves and twigs.
to hide/conceal/disguise/mask/camouflage sth behind sth
to hide/conceal sth under sth
to hide/conceal sth from sb
to hide/conceal/disguise/mask the truth/the fact that…
to hide/conceal the evidence
to hide/conceal/cover your face/mouth/nose/knees, etc.
to hide/conceal/cover/disguise/mask your feelings
a blessing in disguise

data.chText: 因祸得福；祸中有福
data.enText: something that seems to be a problem at first, but that has good results in the end

tr: the act of concealing the identity of something by modifying its appearance
example: he is a master of disguise

tr: any attire that modifies the appearance in order to conceal the wearer's identity
an outward semblance that misrepresents the true nature of something
example: the theatrical notion of disguise is always associated with catastrophe in his stories
The herb masks the garlic taste
We disguised our faces before robbing the bank

value.def: If you are in disguise, you are not wearing your usual clothes or you have altered your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you.

example.ex: You'll have to travel in disguise...
He was wearing that ridiculous disguise...
She's adopted so many disguises her own mother wouldn't recognize her.
example.tran: 她如此乔装改扮，连她妈妈都认不出她了。

value.def: If you disguise yourself, you put on clothes which make you look like someone else or alter your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you.

example.ex: She disguised herself as a man so she could fight on the battlefield.
example.tran: 她女扮男装，这样就可以上战场了。

example.ex: The extremists entered the building disguised as medical workers...
example.tran: 极端分子伪装成医务工作者进入了大楼。
我从头到脚伪装了一番。

value.def: To disguise something means to hide it or make it appear different so that people will not know about it or will not recognize it.

example.ex: He made no attempt to disguise his agitation...
example.tran: 他毫不掩饰自己的焦虑不安。

example.ex: Their healthy image disguises the fact that they are highly processed foods...
example.tran: 它们看上去有益健康，实则掩盖了其为精加工食品这一事实。

example.ex: I played along, and disguised my voice.
example.tran: 我将错就错，换了一副嗓子说话。

example.ex: This is lust thinly disguised as love.
example.tran: 这表面是爱，其实是赤裸的欲望。
